text:
Hi, trying to call contacts getRecentlyModified.
How to define the property parameter? I tried; property=company%2Cfirstname%2Clastname%2Cemail
But no success. Thanks

Hi <@UDJV5B73R>. Thank you for the additional information. For the most part, the HubSpot APIs do not  support cross-origin (CORS) AJAX requests. Making the request client-side using JavaScript would expose any authentication you're using for the request. In order to use JavaScript/AJAX, you would need to make the request (excluding any authentication) to an external server that could then add the needed authentication and make requests to HubSpot's APIs server-side.

There are 2 exceptions to this: The exceptions to this rule are:

1. The Submit form data (AJAX) endpoint, which accepts CORS AJAX form submissions.
2. Most GET requests for published HubDB tables.
you need to repeat the property key, property=company&property=firstname&property=lastname&property=email
haha, that was unexpected! Thanks for the help!
I suspect that the CRM associations and the Contacts API's may be causing the issue as we only accept server-side requests and do not allow client-side or cross-origin requests for those 2 endpoints.
LMK if you have any further questions or I can help any further

Hi, One more question.
When querying contacts is it possible to get the ID of the company(ies) the user is linked to?

We're integrating to a system where hierarchy is Company -> Contacts so the company ID would be ideal.

How to get the company ID?
Thanks
Hi Andreas :wave:. Two great HubSpot tutorials around this topic that I recommend are: HubSpot CMS for Developers: <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers?library=true>
And the build your first web app course: <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/building-your-first-web-app>
Hi Rahmona, ah thanks! i instantly went to the first page an noticed that Jon`s message is not visible in certain circumstances!
i have started the build your app course, i think i should finish it
thanks for the links1
i am super excited to create a template package that i can use for clients based on DnD
Ahh Jon's quote is getting blocked by the popup form! Thanks for letting us know.
quote ! thats the  word i was looking for  :smile:...
The new DnD option is going to be great! Excited to hear how you get on with it and what exciting things you build with it :rocket:

Also if there is some broad topics (HubSpot or general technology related)  you would like to learn more about or have more educational content on to enable you to make great things for clients please dont hesitate to share those thoughts in the ideas channel :bulb:
We love hearing what our developers need to help them succeed :sprocket-dance:

and that is a pretty apparent USP that HubSpot has...i mean, when i joined here  just over a year ago ( with only 500 members at the time, invited by Luke Summerfield) i read about how people thought that it would be super grreat to have this and that sometime in the future. Basically they were talking about the stuff that got delivered with CLI, DnD, the Boilerplate. I was in awe to see so much of what devs  had "on their wishlist" basically delivered... i doubt that that is the case with other Martech Companies, at least not to that extend :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi <@UR8TW5WSU> :wave:. Nice to meet you! I am a developer advocate here at HubSpot and I can help out with this question. I recommend using the CRM Associations API for this situation. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/crm-associations-overview>
In particular the Get associations for a CRM object endpoint: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/get-associations>
Where you can add the contact ID or (vid) to the request URL to find any associated company id's for that particular contact.

You will need to reference the associations definitions table in the overview section for this API to find the definition id you require. In this instance you will need the contact to company definition which is: 1
So your request URL will look like this: GET: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm-associations/v1/associations/CONTACTID/HubSpot_DEFINED/1?hapikey=demo>
Let me know if you have any further questions :slightly_smiling_face:

I just saw this! WOW! Thank you so much for sharing these thoughts! I can wait to share this with the rest of our team! We love hearing what our customers and developers need to help them succeed and grow better so please keep sharing those ideas with us :sprocket-dance:
You haven’t read my first post, i’m doing it all on an external server, the issue is some firewalls block access to external servers on different domains as outlined in the document I linked to
So it all works from my office and at home but the client has a firewall which seems to block the AJAX requests, and this is going to schools which can have over the top firewalls too
Thanks Matt, sorry I missed the first part of your post as it was split from the second post. When the AJAX requests failed was there any error messages or details returned?

Hi <@UFBDBKQ1H>, Thanks a lot for your answer (I'm on Asia time so didn't get the replies till today).
I got an answers from someone else at HubSpot as well and apparently there's a property called _associatedcompanyid_ that will do the trick from contacts.getRecentlyModified directly! But I'll keep that in mind for other associations.
Thanks!
